results.title: Old ground new ground school ground
results.creator_credit: John Nicoll and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: An interview based documentary in which six Melbourne school students from non-English speaking backgrounds talk freely about themselves, their feelings and aspirations, and their experiences in Australian schools and Australian society.

results.title: Old dogs, new tricks
results.brief_description: You learn till you die … it’s the only way. Diminishing mental faculties are not a necessary outcome of old age. This heartening film focuses on a number of people for whom retirement and old age have only served as a springboard to new activities and skills. It clearly demonstrates that stimulation is an important part of keeping independent and motivated.

results.title: Old bottle, new wine
results.brief_description: Tarrango, the first commercially produced all-Austgralian wine is the success story of Merbein, Victoria, horticultural researchers’ quest to breed wine grapes that are uniquely Australian.

results.title: Old and new
results.brief_description: In her house Karen Adams is surrounded by old and new things. Objects that she finds in op shops and on the beach. Things that remind her of home. This digital story was created in partnership with the Koorie heritage Trust.

results.title: Oklahoma!
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Fred Zimmerman, Arthur Hornblow, Rodgers and Hammerstein and Magna Corporation
results.brief_description: Set in the Oklahoma Territory in the early 1900s “Oklahoma!” is an idealised vision of a simpler time, a story of tender romance and violent passion. With choreography by Agnes De Mille, the score is ripe with classics: “Oh, What A Beautiful Mornin’”, “The Surrey With The Fringe On Top”, “People Will Say We’re In Love” “Oaklahoma” and many more. This was the first Rodgers and Hammerstein collaboration, starting the most successful creative partnership in the history of musical theatre.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Orry-Kelly, Fred Zimmerman, Arthur Hornblow, Rodgers and Hammerstein and Magna Corporation

results.title: OK...Camera
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Quebec produces many of the feature films made in Canada. The film looks at this unique, controversial industry; at the people who have succeeded in it (Genevieve Bujold is one) or failed; at its movies, which run the gamut from hard-core skinflicks to such highly acclaimed films as Mon oncle Antoine, and at its audiences, which number in the millions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubbo, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
